a.span: Information and Updates regarding Novel Coronavirus

div.div: Information and Updates Regarding Novel Coronavirus | EducateEveryWhere | Internet Access & Technology | Food Distribution | Universal Access Pilot | Mental Health & Supporting Children | Student Enrichment | Government Aid | California Paid Family Leave

div.span: While schools are closed to students during the COVID-19 Shelter-in-Place, Milpitas Unified School District is continuing to provide:

ul.li: Academic instruction at home through a flexible learning program known as MUSD EducatEveryWhere
Resources to parents for academic and Social Emotional Learning (SEL) support

img.alt: Link to EducatEveryWhere flexible learning site

div.font: Contact Us | Join Us | Staff Resources

span.font: ​The Governing Board is committed to equal opportunity for all individuals in education. District programs, activities, and practices shall be free from discrimination based on race, color, ancestry, national origin, ethnic group identification, age, religion, marital or parental status, physical or mental disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, or genetic information; the perception of one or more of such characteristics; or association with a person or group with one or more of these actual or perceived characteristics. The Board shall promote programs which ensure that discriminatory practices are eliminated in all district activities. (BP 0410)

font.font:
itle IX Coordinator Contact Information:
For complaints regarding Title IX for Staff, Assistant Superintendent, Human Relations,

font.br: For complaints regarding Title IX for Students, Director, Student Services, Carla Crenshaw, ccrenshaw@musd.org
